channel.title: No Signlink file present in client
channel.description:
Alright so i am confused. I have been reading guides about how to add a cache downloader to your client/webclient and they all keep referring to a file called [b]Signlink.java[/b] located inside the client folder with all the java files in it or else inside a folder called Sign>Signlink. But, for some odd reason my client does not contain the file [b]Signlink[/b] and i searched everywhere in it.
I am using the [url=http://silabsoft.org/smf/topic/25044-hyperionproject-annihilation-official-release/]Project Annihilation[/url] client which can be directly downloaded [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=7OTZZRDI]here[/url].
But, my question is how can I add a signlink.java file into my client folder? If manually adding a signlink file, any changes need made to the other java files? Perhaps its already there, but has a different name? Any alternative cache downloader specially made for this?
please help thanks.
EDIT: Someone said that i might be having problems finding the signlink file cause i am using a 459 client and all the tutorials are for like 317.. so does anyone know how to make a cache downloader for my client? or know of any 459 tutorials?

item.title: No Signlink file present in client
item.dc:creator: @desion desion
item.description:
@desion wrote:

[quote=“Project Realm, post:2, topic:359455”]My 562 server has a SignLink.java file, but I am pretty certain that it doesn’t have to do with cache downloading. It’s a separate thread that completes some basic tasks, like checking if the given IP is open or starting a new thread.

If you were to find a SignLink.java file for your client, you would definitely need to modify the other java files. They need to know how to utilize the SignLink file, or else it would have no purpose.[/quote]

Okay thanks, i would really like a cache downloader for my webclient, so could you follow me through with incorporating a signlink file into my client, as well as what i need to edit in the other java files. Unless there is a alternative method to making a cache downloader that would be easier. There is a direct link to the client in my first post if you would like to look over it. thanks again.

Read full topic
item.source: No Signlink file present in client

item.title: No Signlink file present in client
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

My 562 server has a SignLink.java file, but I am pretty certain that it doesn’t have to do with cache downloading. It’s a separate thread that completes some basic tasks, like checking if the given IP is open or starting a new thread.

If you were to find a SignLink.java file for your client, you would definitely need to modify the other java files. They need to know how to utilize the SignLink file, or else it would have no purpose.

Read full topic
item.source: No Signlink file present in client
